help.title: Mapeo
help.welcome:
This is an offline editor for [OpenStreetMap](http://www.openstreetmap.org/), the
free and editable map of the world. You can use it to add and update
data in your area, making an open-source and open-data map of the world
better for everyone.

Edits that you make on this map will be visible only to people you share with. 

The [iD editor](http://ideditor.com/) is a collaborative project with [source
code available on GitHub](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD). Mapeo is also open source and [available on GitHub](https://github.com/digidem/mapeo-desktop)

welcome.welcome: Welcome! This walkthrough will teach you the basics of editing on Mapeo.

editing.save: Click {save} **Save** to finish your edits and save them to your computer. You should remember to save your work frequently! No one else can see what you save until you syncronize with them.
editing.upload: Before saving your changes you must enter a [changeset comment](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Good_changeset_comments). Then click **Save** so your changes will be merged into the map.

feature_editor.type: You can click on the feature type to change the feature to a different type. Everything that exists in the real world can be added, so there are thousands of feature types to choose from.
feature_editor.fields_all_fields: The "All fields" section contains all of the feature's details that you may edit. All of the fields are optional, and it's OK to leave a field blank if you are unsure.
feature_editor.tags_all_tags: Below the fields section, you can expand the "All tags" section to edit any of the *tags* for the selected feature. Each tag consists of a *key* and *value*, data elements that define all of the features.

points.delete_point: It's OK to delete features that don't exist in the real world. Deleting a feature removes it from the map, so you should make sure a feature is really gone before you delete it.

commit.title: Save your Edits
commit.upload_explanation: The changes you save will only be visible on maps that you syncronize with.
commit.upload_explanation_with_user: The changes you save as {user} will be visible on all maps that you syncronize with.
